## Indicator: Child population by race

**This code populates historic estimates of population by race for age groups. The API call does not allow for multiple predicates to filter by both age and race. The dataset for 2000-2010 can be downloaded here**
https://www.census.gov/data/datasets/time-series/demo/popest/intercensal-2000-2010-counties.html 

**Variable codes:**
https://www2.census.gov/programs-surveys/popest/technical-documentation/file-layouts/2000-2010/intercensal/county/co-est00int-alldata.pdf

**Created by:** Xanna Burg
**Date:** April 2020
**Updated by:**

**Data Source:** U.S. Census Bureau, Annual Population Estimates. Specific table: pep/charagegroups 
**Purpose:** Connect to census data table, clean data, add to master database, output csv to upload to Data Center in correct format. Update Montana, North Dakota, and South Dakota KIDS COUNT Data Center indicator with most recent year of vintage data.
**Description:** this program calculates **two indicators: Child population by race and Child population by age group and race**
* Geographies: state total, county, state planning regions (where applicable, which are groups of counties)
* Number - count of population
* Note - this data uses un-bridged race categories


**Data format:** final output csv to upload is in long format with the following variables: Location (character: name of location), TimeFrame (numeric: year), Data (numeric: number or percentage), DataFormat (character: "number" or "percent"), LocationId (numeric: assigned for KIDS COUNT system), Race (character), Age group (character)



```{r,message=FALSE}
#load required packages
library(tidyverse)
library(tidycensus)
library(censusapi)
library(stringr)
```


```{r}
#COUNTY DATA
pop_county <- pop_data %>%
  
  #create the timeframe using the Date codes
  mutate(timeframe=case_when(
    YEAR==2 ~ '2000',
    YEAR==3 ~ '2001',
    YEAR==4 ~ '2002',
    YEAR==5 ~ '2003',
    YEAR==6 ~ '2004',
    YEAR==7 ~ '2005',
    YEAR==8 ~ '2006',
    YEAR==9 ~ '2007',
    YEAR==10 ~ '2008',
    YEAR==11 ~ '2009')) %>%
  subset(!is.na(timeframe)) %>%
  
  mutate(county=gsub("\\s*\\w*$", "", CTYNAME)) %>%
  
  #only include age groups 1 through 4
  subset(AGEGRP==1 | AGEGRP==2 | AGEGRP==3 | AGEGRP==4) %>%
  
  #create sums for race across all child age groups
  group_by(county,timeframe) %>%
  summarise(totalchildpop=sum(TOT_POP),
            white=sum(WA_MALE)+sum(WA_FEMALE),
            black=sum(BA_MALE)+sum(BA_FEMALE),
            aindian=sum(IA_MALE)+sum(IA_FEMALE),
            asian=sum(AA_MALE)+sum(AA_FEMALE),
            hawaiian=sum(NA_MALE)+sum(NA_FEMALE),
            multiple=sum(TOM_MALE)+sum(TOM_FEMALE)) %>%
  
  #calculate percents while in wide format
  
  mutate(white_per=white/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(black_per=black/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(aindian_per=aindian/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(asian_per=asian/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(hawaiian_per=hawaiian/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(multiple_per=multiple/totalchildpop) 

#separate number
pop_county_number <- pop_county %>%
  select(-c(white_per,black_per,aindian_per,asian_per,hawaiian_per,multiple_per,totalchildpop)) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols=c(white,black,aindian,asian,hawaiian,multiple),names_to='race',values_to='data') %>%
  
  rename(location=county) %>%
  mutate(locationtype='County') %>%
  mutate(state=statename) %>%
  mutate(vintageyear=year) %>%
  mutate(dataformat='Number') %>%
  mutate(varname='childpopulationbyrace') %>%
  
  mutate(race=case_when(
    race=='white' ~ 'White',
    race=='black' ~ 'Black or African American',
    race=='aindian' ~ 'American Indian and Alaska Native',
    race=='asian' ~ 'Asian',
    race=='hawaiian' ~ 'Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander',
    race=='multiple' ~ 'Two or more races'))

#separate percentage
pop_county_percent <- pop_county %>%
  select(-c(white,black,aindian,asian,hawaiian,multiple,totalchildpop)) %>%
  pivot_longer(cols=c(white_per,black_per,aindian_per,asian_per,hawaiian_per,multiple_per),names_to='race',values_to='data') %>%
  
  rename(location=county) %>%
  mutate(locationtype='County') %>%
  mutate(state=statename) %>%
  mutate(vintageyear=year) %>%
  mutate(dataformat='Percent') %>%
  mutate(varname='childpopulationbyrace') %>%
  
  mutate(race=case_when(
    race=='white_per' ~ 'White',
    race=='black_per' ~ 'Black or African American',
    race=='aindian_per' ~ 'American Indian and Alaska Native',
    race=='asian_per' ~ 'Asian',
    race=='hawaiian_per' ~ 'Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander',
    race=='multiple_per' ~ 'Two or more races'))
  

###########
#STATE DATA
pop_state_number <- pop_county_number %>%
  group_by(race,timeframe) %>%
  summarise(data=sum(data)) %>%
  mutate(location=statename) %>%
  mutate(state=statename) %>%
  mutate(vintageyear=year) %>%
  mutate(locationtype='State') %>%
  mutate(dataformat='Number') %>%
  mutate(varname='childpopulationbyrace')


pop_state_percent <- pop_county %>%

  summarise(totalchildpop=sum(totalchildpop),
            totalwhite=sum(white),
            totalblack=sum(black),
            totalaindian=sum(aindian),
            totalasian=sum(asian),
            totalhawaiian=sum(hawaiian),
            totalmultiple=sum(multiple)) %>%

  mutate(black_per=totalblack/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(aindian_per=totalaindian/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(asian_per=totalasian/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(hawaiian_per=totalhawaiian/totalchildpop) %>%
  mutate(multiple_per=totalmultiple/totalchildpop) %>%
  
  select(-c(totalchildpop,totalwhite,totalblack,totalaindian,totalasian,totalhawaiian,totalmultiple)) %>%
  
  pivot_longer(cols=c(white_per,black_per,aindian_per,asian_per,hawaiian_per,multiple_per),names_to='race',values_to='data') %>%
  
    mutate(race=case_when(
    race=='white_per' ~ 'White',
    race=='black_per' ~ 'Black or African American',
    race=='aindian_per' ~ 'American Indian and Alaska Native',
    race=='asian_per' ~ 'Asian',
    race=='hawaiian_per' ~ 'Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander',
    race=='multiple_per' ~ 'Two or more races')) %>%

  mutate(location=statename) %>%
  mutate(state=statename) %>%
  mutate(vintageyear=year) %>%
  mutate(locationtype='State') %>%
  mutate(dataformat='Percent') %>%
  mutate(varname='childpopulationbyrace')

#REGION DATA
pop_region_number <- pop_county_number %>%
  ungroup %>%
  mutate(location=replace(location, 
                          statename=='Montana' & location=='Lewis and Clark',

                          statename=='South Dakota' & location=='Shannon',

pop_region_percent <- pop_county %>%

    mutate(race=case_when(

    race=='hawaiian_per' ~ 'Native Hawaiian and Other Pacific Islander',
    race=='multiple_per' ~ 'Two or more races')) %>%

  rename(location=region) %>%
  mutate(state=statename) %>%
  mutate(vintageyear=year) %>%
  mutate(locationtype='Planning Region') %>%

```

```{r}
#UNION COUNTY, STATE, STATE PLANNING REGION
pop <- pop_county_number %>%
  bind_rows(pop_county_percent) %>%
  bind_rows(pop_state_number) %>%
  bind_rows(pop_state_percent) %>%
  bind_rows(pop_region_number) %>%
  bind_rows(pop_region_percent) %>%
  
  ungroup %>%

  #merge in location ids
  mutate(location=replace(location, 
                          statename=='Montana' & location=='Lewis and Clark', 
                          'Lewis & Clark')) %>%
  mutate(location=replace(location, 
                          statename=='South Dakota' & location=='Shannon', 
                          'Oglala Lakota')) %>%
  left_join(locationids,by=c('location'='Location')) %>%
  rename(locationid=LocationId)
```
